page.title: 20Rural transport
page.content: There are few buses in the area, and no railway since the railway from Worcester to Leominster closed down over twenty years ago. There is a bus service five days a week which runs along the road from Bromyard to Bishops Frome and Hereford, passing through Munderfield village. This takes school children and workers in the mornings and brings them back in the early evenings. On Saturday a bus goes through the south east corner of the block running from Bishops Frome to Worcester. Most families have cars as it is very difficult to live in the country without some form of personal transport. A few people cycle, but with so much heavy traffic around this can be dangerous. The large lorries particularly the articulated ones make the minor roads unpleasant for other users and break up the road surfaces.
